text: All Fimir Mearghs are acomppained by a noxious mist that demoralises and poisons their enemies. Skattach is no exception.
The caster opens a rift into the Realm of Chaos and binds a pack of Swamp Daemons to their will.

At the tip of this magical staff rests an ancient Fimir artifact known as "Balor's Eye" a magically preserved eye said to belong to the myterious Fimir god, able to open a rift into the Realm of Chaos and suck all of the user's enemies within.
These unnatural creatures require magic to exist - the more the better. If the winds of magic blow strongly, they are more stable on the battlefield.
The Fimir will do anything for but a moment of attention from the Dark Gods. No act of bravery is too foolhardy, no act of cruelty too savage.
Under the Eyes of the Gods
The Great Eye is always watching
Under the stern gaze of Balor, the Fimir dare not waver in the face of the enemy.
Fen Hulks are embodiments of the corrupted lands of Albion. Wherever they go, the land is corrupted into muddy bogs which greatly hinder their enemies.
Fimir surround themselves with a magically-created mist, through which the Fimir are barely discernable from a distance of more than a few metres.
